td.a: DE263

tr.td: Indicates if the client received a dose within 24 hours of birth. Whether a birth dose is counted as part of the primary series will depend on the antigen

td.a: DE203

tr.td: Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen

td.a: DE257

tr.td: Indicates if the client has completed the booster series of a product/antigen

td.a: DE242

tr.td: Date when primary vaccination series was completed
The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)

td.a: DE204

tr.td: The current HIV status of the client

td.a: DE208

tr.td: The infant was preterm; the mother gave birth to the infant when gestational age was less than 37 weeks

td.a: DE209

tr.td: The client is known to be immunocompromised. This means the client has a weakened immune system and having a reduced ability to fight infections and other diseases

td.a: DE210

tr.td: The client is currently receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART)

td.a: DE243

tr.td: Type of TB infection test performed
The type of tuberculosis (TB) infection test performed

td.a: DE246

tr.td: Records the result of the TB infection test

td.a: DE249

tr.td: The client is living with HIV and is immunologically stable with CD4 count or percentage above a minimum as defined in the HIV guidelines

td.a: DE250

tr.td: The client is living with HIV and is clinically well, as defined in HIV guidelines and WHO clinical staging

td.a: DE211

tr.td: Represents the client's birth weight value measures in grams

td.a: DE215

tr.td: The date on which the client started or restarted ART

td.a: DE251

tr.td: The client is at high risk for pneumococcal infection because of underlying medical conditions (i.e. HIV infection or sickle-cell disease)

td.a: DE236

tr.td: Age in months when client received first meningococcal dose
The age in months when client received their first meningococcal dose

td.a: DE240

tr.td: Vaccine-induced neutralizing antibody (VNA) level, measured as a serum antibody concentration from the result of the concentrated, purified cell culture-derived and embryonated egg-based rabies vaccines (CCEEV)

td.a: DE253

tr.td: Risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus
Professional at risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus, particularly animal health workers. Also considered for medical professionals who regularly provide care to persons with rabies

td.a: DE241

tr.td: Indicates the result of a serological test determining whether the client has antibodies against the dengue virus

td.a: DE201

tr.td: The date and time of the client's contact

td.a: DE202

tr.td: The antenatal care (ANC) contact or visit number
